definition: mad about money (idiom)
money/wealth/riches/property/valuables
to bewilder/crazy about/fan/enthusiast/lost/confused
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)

sentences.english: We all need to use money but we need to be careful that we don't become tainted by it.
sentences.chinese: 我们都需要钱，但要小心不要因此而财迷心窍。

sentences.english: E. g. : Lisa is really monday hungry, who cares nothing but her wages.
sentences.chinese: 莉萨真是财迷心窍，一心只关心她工资。

sentences.english: Everything in our sight turns into the gold ingots.
sentences.chinese: 眼里看到的，什么都象元宝，真是个财迷心窍的民族。

definition: to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
blinded by greed (idiom)
to lose one's head through material greed (idiom)
seeing riches provokes evil designs
to be obsessed/to be possessed
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to be greedy in getting money
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
lit. to love money as much as one's own life (idiom)/fig. avaricious/tightfisted
ill-gotten wealth or gains
greedy
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking
it goes against one's conscience
variant of 鋌而走險|铤而走险[ting3 er2 zou3 xian3]
(of greed, lust etc) to dominate one's thoughts
